title: failed to WriteRawTransactions: bucket: BlockTransaction, mdbx_cursor_put: MDBX_MAP_FULL: Environment mapsize limit reached
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `./erigon --version`
erigon version 2022.04.5-deprecated

OS & Version: Windows/Linux/OSX
Docker, Alpine Linux v3.15

#### Expected behaviour
Blocks are synchronized

#### Actual behaviour
I have 3 erigon nodes with stable version on different servers, all of them are stuck with the following error messages.

#### Backtrace

````
[INFO] [07-06|10:49:23.038] [3/16 Bodies] Processing bodies...       from=15062575 to=15088483
[INFO] [07-06|10:49:53.041] [3/16 Bodies] Wrote block bodies         block_num=15062691 delivery/sec="32.14 MiB" wasted/sec="0.00 B" alloc="1.74 GiB" sys="1.89 GiB"
[INFO] [07-06|10:50:12.041] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=3
[EROR] [07-06|10:50:22.485] Staged Sync                              error="[3/16 Bodies] writing block body: failed to WriteRawTransactions: bucket: BlockTransaction, mdbx_cursor_put: MDBX_MAP_FULL: Environment mapsize limit reached"
[INFO] [07-06|10:50:23.020] [3/16 Bodies] Processing bodies...       from=15062575 to=15088483
[INFO] [07-06|10:50:53.021] [3/16 Bodies] Wrote block bodies         block_num=15062748 delivery/sec="43.42 MiB" wasted/sec="832.42 KiB" alloc="2.51 GiB" sys="3.83 GiB"
[EROR] [07-06|10:51:07.713] Staged Sync                              error="[3/16 Bodies] writing block body: failed to WriteRawTransactions: bucket: BlockTransaction, mdbx_cursor_put: MDBX_MAP_FULL: Environment mapsize limit reached"
````

Thanks @NarupoomChaisawat, 
I've checked out 2022.04.05-deprecated tag, updated libmbdx submodule to the latest commit and rebuilt erigon.
Unfortunately, nothing changed :(
Fixed by https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/pull/4638

Thanks @AskAlexSharov , but rebuilding from latest commit of stable branch and replacing binary didn't help :(
Started resync from scratch on one of nodes.

- what is your db size now? 
- show logs of Erigon when it starting

```
2.1T    ./chaindata
0       ./LOCK
4.0K    ./nodekey
1.3G    ./nodes
0       ./transactions.rlp
2.1G    ./txpool
```

right. here is the fix: https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/pull/4669

Thank you @AskAlexSharov , unfortunately, that didn't help :(

@darkhorse-spb hi, still have this problem?
@AskAlexSharov yes, nothing has changed on two of my three nodes. The third node, where I've started resync from scratch, is likely to reach the actual height tonight (if it not fails again..).
@darkhorse-spb , try start node on branch `stable_dbg_full` and show logs

